title: shouldFailConnectingToNodeWithWsRpcDisabled Failed in Acceptance Test

labels.name: flake
labels.description: 60% of the time it works 100% of the time.

body:
it seems to be a flaky test. After relaunching it was ok

>org.hyperledger.besu.tests.acceptance.RpcApisTogglesAcceptanceTest > 
shouldFailConnectingToNodeWithWsRpcDisabled failed on a CI build

````
org.hyperledger.besu.tests.acceptance.RpcApisTogglesAcceptanceTest > shouldFailConnectingToNodeWithWsRpcDisabled FAILED
    org.awaitility.core.ConditionTimeoutException: Assertion condition defined as a lambda expression in org.hyperledger.besu.tests.acceptance.dsl.condition.net.AwaitNetPeerCount 
    Expecting:
     <1>
    to be equal to:
     <2>
    but was not within 30 seconds.
        at org.awaitility.core.ConditionAwaiter.await(ConditionAwaiter.java:165)

        at org.hyperledger.besu.tests.acceptance.dsl.node.cluster.Cluster.start(Cluster.java:67)
        at org.hyperledger.besu.tests.acceptance.RpcApisTogglesAcceptanceTest.before(RpcApisTogglesAcceptanceTest.java:39)

        Caused by:
        org.opentest4j.AssertionFailedError: 
        Expecting:
         <1>
        to be equal to:
         <2>
        but was not.
            at jdk.internal.reflect.GeneratedConstructorAccessor23.newInstance(Unknown Source)
````

we haven't seen this again recently, right? let's close for now if you agree @matkt
yes we can close this one. thanks
